channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Raised paving, 16th August
item.description:
I measured these paving slabs and they seem to be raised to 2.5cm, but there is some detritus there, which makes it difficult to be exact. I think it meets the standard for a "priority 1 footway repair, which must have a depth of at least 25mm or above". Would someone inspect this please, to see if it warrants repair? Thank you. https://www.bexley.gov.uk/about-the-council/response-standards/highways-service-level-agreements

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harlington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Cycle way barriers removed, 16th August
item.description:
Deliberate removal of cycle way barriers opposite One Stop builders merchants. Removed by staff to enable large Lorrie’s to park to unload. These barriers are replaced on a weekly basis and removed by workers the same day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 383, Hertford Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 16th August
item.description:
This car has been here since 3/3/25. It says it’s broken down awaiting recovery but I am concerned it’s more likely dumped. The back wheel has been removed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ashenden Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 16th August
item.description:
There is a noisy loose manhole cover in the middle of the highway in front of Giddy Up coffee shop on Goswell Road. I think it’s on the Islington side but on the border with the city of London.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Goswell Road, Finsbury, City of London

item.title: Metal fence being removed, 16th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: OHV on PROW, 16th August
item.description:
At various places along the length of the Cow Path there is OHV including nettles and brambles etc. - please can it all be cut back before the kids return to school.? Also vegetation needs lots of clearing out please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak from valve cover, 16th August
item.description:
Second report for same road - but different location (perhaps related though). This valve cover is on teh patch near the road on the corner nearest to A1 Carriages. The water has been leaking for so long that green algae is visible in the water. Thames Water reporting page doesn;t appear to be functional
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Obstruction - Overgrown / overhanging private tree / hedge

item.title: Abandoned van, 16th August
item.description:
Van has been in the same location for 6 months roughly, potentially dumped or abandoned, it has been parked in the same spot behind the residential/business area for a long length of time and has grass growing underneath the vehicle as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Valve cover leaking on patch next to main road, 16th August
item.description:
I tried to report to Thames Water but their reporting page seems not to be functional. There's been a leak from the valve cover for weeks. At road level. Residential house 32 is the nearest.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71A, Crayford Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned and probably stolen moped, 16th August
item.description:
Abandoned and likely stolen moped, dumped in the trees just to the east of the entrance to Merryhills School on Glenbrook South

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenbrook South, London
